input: What does Section 99 of the IPC define?
target: Section 99 limits the right of private defense, excluding acts against public servants or causing excessive harm.

input: Does Section 99 apply to all acts of private defense?
target: No, Section 99 restricts private defense in cases involving public servants acting in good faith.

input: What is an example of a limitation under Section 99?
target: Using excessive force to repel a minor threat is not justified under Section 99.

input: Does Section 99 allow harm to innocent persons?
target: No, harm to innocent persons is not justified under Section 99.

input: What is the significance of Section 99?
target: Section 99 ensures that the right of private defense is exercised within reasonable limits.
